Description: Bone disc with three lathed grooves in the edge, probably the base or lid of a small box; broken at the edges in several places, in one case providing a full view of the heart of the ivory; surfaces crossed by oblique lines suggesting wear on the ivory.
Curator's comments: Material identified by François Popin in Aprill 2007. Part of a cluster of Late Bronze Age material found unregistered in 1974, comparable to material from Enkomi, Maroni, Hala Sultan Tekke, Kourion etc, though its generic type could place it later in date.
